page.title: 11"M55 an aw that": a poem
page.content:
{Mary Smith writes about the building {of the M55 motorway.}(Extracts)
T'new Motorway's comin..well they've getten agate, Fer gret lorries are facing frae early till late, TIMTHE They're loaded wi gravel an stooan An they've shifted no end o rich soil off t'land..... Weear acres o corn grew an lovely green grass, Ther's nowt to be sin but a gret muddy mess.... Wither it proves to be 'Progress' or a 'Catastrophy', If a loaf costs five bob, an petrol a pound, We'd do better wi{wheeat,}than wi { tarmac}on t'ground.
